channel.title: Bloomberg Markets

item.title: Oil Extends Slump as Trump Announces Ceasefire in Middle East
item.description: Oil extended a slump as US President Donald Trump announced a tentative ceasefire between Iran and Israel.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen

media:content.media:description: Oil storage tanks at the Sunoco LP Terminal in Crockett, California, US, on Friday, Jan. 3, 2025. Oil began 2025 by rising to the highest level since November, boosted by a report of shrinking crude stockpiles in the US and bullish technical indicators.

item.title: Gold Falls as Haven Demand Ebbs After Trump Announces Ceasefire
item.description: Gold retreated as haven demand ebbed after US President Donald Trump announced that Israel and Iran had agreed to a ceasefire.
item.dc:creator: Jason Scott

item.title: Japan’s 20-Year Sale Shows Market Still Wary on Longer Bonds
item.description: Demand at Japan’s 20-year bond sale was slightly lower than the average over the past year, indicating that investors are still cautious even after the government adjusted its borrowing plans to calm a surge in yields.
item.dc:creator: Mia Glass

item.title: Tata Capital Is Said to Get SEBI Approval for $2 Billion IPO
item.description: Tata Capital Ltd. received the approval of India’s markets regulator to proceed with its plans for an initial public offering that may fetch about $2 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, in what is expected to be the country’s biggest listing this year.
item.dc:creator: Rajesh Mascarenhas, Baiju Kalesh

item.title: Oil Falls, Stocks Rally as Trump Announces Truce: Markets Wrap
item.description: Oil slumped and stocks gained after President Donald Trump said Israel and Iran had agreed to a ceasefire, spurring optimism there will be a lasting pause in the Middle East conflict.
item.dc:creator: Winnie Hsu, Jason Scott

item.title: Is It Over When Trump Says It’s Over? We’ll See
item.description: Oil prices couldn’t wait to fall again, but it’s unclear what Iran has really agreed to.
item.dc:creator: John Authers

media:content.media:description: Smoke rises as Israel targets the notorious Evin Prison in north of Tehran, on June 23.

item.title: Standard Bank Chairman on Managing Uncertainties
item.description: Nonkululeko Nyembezi, Chairman at Africa's Standard Bank Group, says the Africa continent is facing uncertainty that is at a "level that is hard to cope with." She speaks with Stephen Engle on the sidelines at the World Economic Forum’s Annual Meeting of the New Champions in Tianjin. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SNB Rate Seen Stuck at Zero This Year After Last Week’s Cut
item.description: The Swiss National Bank probably won’t act this year on its threat of cutting borrowing costs to below zero, according to a majority of economists.
item.dc:creator: Bastian Benrath-Wright, Harumi Ichikura

media:content.media:description: The Swiss National Bank in Bern, Switzerland.

item.title: Hungary Is Set to Hold Interest Rates as Price Curbs Fall Short
item.description: Hungary’s central bank is likely to keep its key interest rate unchanged for a ninth month, holding steady amid mounting geopolitical risks and persistently high inflation expectations.
item.dc:creator: Zoltan Simon, Marton Kasnyik

item.title: JD's Shen on China's Ability to Handle External Shocks
item.description: Jianguang Shen, Chief Economist at e-commerce giant JD.com, discusses his outlook for China's economy given escalated geopolitical tensions and trade uncertainties. He speaks with Stephen Engle on the sidelines at the World Economic Forum’s Annual Meeting of the New Champions in Tianjin. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: McKinsey's Ngai on China's Macroeconomic Shifts
item.description: Joe Ngai, Chairman at McKinsey Greater China, discusses the industries that he thinks China will be leading the world in the future and drivers for their growth. He speaks with Stephen Engle on the sidelines at the World Economic Forum’s Annual Meeting of the New Champions in Tianjin. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Korea Bourse Readies to Start Carbon-Emissions Futures
item.description: South Korea’s main stock exchange plans to roll out futures on carbon emissions to deepen the market for the sector and help with the nation’s push toward net-zero emissions by 2050.
item.dc:creator: Savio Shetty, Youkyung Lee

item.title: JPMorgan Sees Asian Tech Stocks Gaining Another 15-20% This Year
item.description: Asian technology stocks may rally another 15%-20% this year, driven mainly by the strong momentum in the artificial intelligence space, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.
item.dc:creator: Jeanny Yu

item.title: Adnoc’s $19B Santos Bid Tests Australian Energy Path
item.description:
Australian regulators and politicians are weighing the implications of Abu Dhabi National Oil Co.'s $19 billion bid for Santos, one of the biggest foreign takeovers in the country's history. EnergyQuest CEO and former Santos executive Rick Wilkinson says maintaining domestic gas supply will be a top priority for Canberra. He discusses the significance of the deal and the impact of Middle East tensions on global energy markets on 'Bloomberg: The Asia Trade'.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Korea Open to Funding Indian Shipyards Involving Its Firms
item.description: Two South Korean government-backed lenders are open to providing cheap loans to Indian shipyards that are willing to partner with the east Asian nation’s shipbuilders, according to people familiar.
item.dc:creator: Mihir Mishra

item.title: Oil, Gas Slide After Trump Announces Israel-Iran Truce
item.description: Energy commodities extended their slide after Trump announced a truce between Israel and Iran, with traders dialing down concerns of supply disruptions. BloombergNEF's Global Head of Commodities, Energy and Environmental Markets Ashish Sethia weighs in on 'Bloomberg: The Asia Trade.' (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Emerging Assets Gain as Mideast Tension Eases with Ceasefire
item.description: Emerging market assets advanced after US President Donald Trump announced a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, bolstering risk sentiment across the region.
item.dc:creator: Jaehyun Eom, Matthew Burgess

item.title: Ex-Soros Allocator Leads Andon’s NY Hedge Fund Push
item.description: Investment firm Andon Hong Kong Ltd. is opening an office in New York to deepen its push into alternatives.
item.dc:creator: Diana Li

item.title: Gold Miner Shanjin Is Said to Pick Banks for Hong Kong Listing
item.description: Shanjin International Gold Co. has picked banks for a Hong Kong listing, according to people familiar with the matter, as the Chinese miner seeks to take advantage of high bullion prices.
item.dc:creator: Pei Li, Julia Fioretti, Chongjing Li

item.title: Enodo Economics on Global Economic Outlook
item.description:
Diana Choyleva, Chief Economist at Enodo Economics, discusses her outlook for global economies amid looming tariff negotiations and geopolitical tensions. She speaks with Stephen Engle on the sidelines at the World Economic Forum’s Annual Meeting of the New Champions in Tianjin on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade".
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Weak Dollar May Revive Foreign Fund Inflows to India
item.description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Joshi

item.title: Kospi Surges to Lead Stock Gains in Asia After Mideast Ceasefire
item.description: Asia’s stock benchmark climbed the most in seven weeks, led by technology shares, as risk sentiment improved after US President Donald Trump announced a tentative ceasefire between Israel and Iran.
item.dc:creator: Winnie Hsu

media:content.media:description: A screen displays the Korea Composite Stock Price Index (KOSPI) and the exchange rate between the South Korean won and US dollar inside a trading room at Hana Bank in Seoul, South Korea.

item.title: Japanese Stocks Gain on News of Tentative Israel-Iran Ceasefire
item.description: Japanese equities rose for the first day in four after US President Donald Trump’s announcement of a tentative ceasefire between Iran and Israel soothed market sentiment.
item.dc:creator: Momoka Yokoyama, Toshiro Hasegawa

item.title: Virgin Australia CEO Downplays Mideast Fears as Shares Debut
item.description: Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Dave Emerson brushed away concerns the Middle East conflict will disrupt demand for travel as the airline surged on its return to the stock exchange in Sydney.
item.dc:creator: Angus Whitley

item.title: Bain’s Virgin Australia Advances in Sydney After Relisting
item.description: Bain Capital’s Virgin Australia rose in Sydney trading after raising A$685 million ($444 million) in one of the country’s biggest initial public offerings of the year.
item.dc:creator: Carmeli Argana

media:content.media:description: A Virgin Australia plane takes off at Sydney Airport.

item.title: Oil Prices Fall as Trump Announces Ceasefire Between Iran and Israel
item.description: Oil extended a slump as President Donald Trump announced a tentative ceasefire between Iran and Israel. Stephen Stapczynski reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Rio Tinto Joins Hancock to Develop $1.6 Billion Iron Ore Project
item.description: Rio Tinto Group will team up up with Australia’s richest person to develop a $1.6 billion, 31 million ton-a-year iron ore mine in the Pilbara mining hub.
item.dc:creator: Paul-Alain Hunt

item.title: UK: Iran Has Opportunity to Move Toward De-Escalation
item.description: UK Secretary of State for Science, Innovation and Technology Peter Kyle believes Iran has the opportunity to move toward de-escalation. He speaks with Avril Hong and Haidi Stroud-Watts on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: New Zealand Farmers Lack Succession Plan as Debt Spooks Children
item.description: New Zealand farmers are finding it harder to interest their children in taking over the family business amid high costs and the waning lure of living on the land, according to a new report.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Withers

media:content.media:description: A farmer lays out feed for dairy cows at a farm in Hamilton, New Zealand.

item.title: China Expands Its Coal Exports and Shrinks Imports Due to Glut
item.description: China’s coal glut is resulting in an increasing number of unwanted cargoes being offered abroad.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Kathy Chen
